intro: Maianthemum comaltepecense, commonly known as the Comaltepec starflower, is a rare flowering plant native to the cloud forests of southern Mexico. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its delicate, star-shaped white flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, berry-like fruits that are dispersed by birds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is adapted to the specific microclimates of its native habitat. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is of particular interest to botanists studying plant biodiversity in tropical regions.
